Paul Conroy.Action: Screams for help and shows panic when trapped in the coffin.
Attempts to sit up and move despite being confined and bound, uses a Zippo lighter to see in the dark.
Panics instantly upon realizing he is buried alive, screams and flails about frantically.
Tries desperately to free himself using a rusty nail despite difficult conditions.
Attempts to calm himself despite extreme distress and fear.
Uses a rusty nail to cut through the ropes binding his hands despite the tight quarters and difficulty.
Attempts to pry off the coffin lid with violent movements but fails due to the reinforced coffin and surrounding sand.
Struggles to calm himself and eventually achieves some semblance of calm despite extreme stress and limited oxygen.
Removes his shirt to cope with unbearable heat inside the coffin.
Cries openly in the coffin after failed escape attempts, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Frantically tries to reach the ringing phone despite physical discomfort, showing persistence but no direct social interaction.
Attempts to push the coffin lid off using leg strength but fails after several tries and becomes exhausted.
Drops his feet after failed attempts and allows himself a moment of emotional release (crying).
Notices a small hole near his head but does not immediately act on it.
Extinguishes the lighter to conserve oxygen and avoid attracting attention.
Responds quickly and carefully to the buzzing and flickering light from the phone near his feet, showing alertness.
Struggles to reposition himself in the confined space to reach the phone but persists until successful.
Clamps the phone between his feet and maneuvers his body to grab it with his hands, demonstrating resourcefulness and physical coordination.
Barely notices the text message waiting on the phone, indicating possible distraction or emotional overwhelm.
Screams for help repeatedly and tries to call 911 despite difficult circumstances.
Frantically searches for the Safe Number and important items, showing desperation and vulnerability.
Struggles to remember the Safe Number and cannot recall it fully, then closes the phone.
Frantically searches pockets for the Safe Number paper but finds it missing along with other important items.
Screams for help despite knowing the limited chance of being heard through the coffin walls.
Dials 001 then 911 on the phone and successfully connects to a 911 operator.
Accidentally puts out the Zippo flame by banging its cap against the coffin wall during a moment of panic.
Pleading for help sincerely and expressing fear openly to the 911 operator.
Struggling to remain coherent due to panic but still trying to communicate clearly.

Has trouble remaining coherent and struggles to provide clear information about his location.

Gives up on the call after realizing the conversation is not helping, showing frustration but no hostility or blame.

Fails to provide accurate location information, causing confusion in the emergency response.
Attempts to use the phone to call for help and checks battery life, showing presence of mind and resourcefulness.
Gives up on the call after realizing it is not helping, showing a moment of despair but also practical recognition of the situation.
Leaves urgent, caring voice messages for his wife and family, pleading for help and showing concern for their safety.
Immediately dials a number he can recall with ease and attempts to contact his home and wife to alert them of the emergency.
Leaves a frenzied, rambling message on the answering machine, showing urgency but some loss of composure.
Clearly communicates the critical situation and instructs his wife to contact authorities if he cannot be reached.
Pleadingly asks his loved one to call him, showing vulnerability and concern.
Tries to conserve oxygen by extinguishing the Zippo lighter, showing self-control and consideration.

Recognizes the importance of conserving oxygen and extinguishes the Zippo lighter to preserve air.
Attempts to calm himself and control his breathing despite panic and hyperventilation.
Uses the phone to try to contact the FBI by dialing 411 and requesting connection to any FBI field office.
Shows frustration and impatience when the 411 operator lists multiple cities, but adapts by choosing Chicago to proceed.
Appears nervous and somewhat disorganized (fishing for pens, holding phone with shoulder), indicating stress but still manages to continue efforts to communicate.
Carefully writes down the phone number despite pen failure, showing persistence and calm under pressure.
Calls the FBI to ask for help, clearly trusting others and seeking assistance sincerely.
Calmly explains the dangerous situation involving innocent people and children, indicating concern for others.

Successfully navigates an automated phone system and connects directly to the FBI.
